definitions.body: a terror = obj. of terror, ‖[[גּׁבַהּ]] Ez Eze 1:18 (del. Co).

fear of God, reverence, piety [[יִרְאַת אֱלֽהִים]] Ge 20:11 (E), 2Sa 23:3, Ne 5:15; [[שַׁדַּי]] ´[[יר]] Job 6:14; [[אֱלֽהֵינוּ]] ´[[יר]] Ne 5:9; [[יהוה]] ´[[יר]] 2Ch 19:9, Is 11:3, Is 33:6, Ps 34:12, Pr 10:27, Pr 14:26, Pr 14:27, Pr 15:16, Pr 19:23, Pr 22:4, Pr 23:17; ‖ the knowledge (of God) Pr 1:29, Pr 2:5, Is 11:2; is the beginning of wisdom Ps 111:10, Pr 9:10, and knowledge Pr 1:7; the instruction of wisdom Pr 15:33, is to hate evil Pr 8:13, and it involves departing from evil Pr 16:6; [[אֲדׂנׇי]] ´[[י]] is wisdom Job 28:28; [[יִרְאָה]] is defined by context Job 15:4; with sfs. these are usually obj., fear of him Ex 20:20 (E), of thee Ps 5:8, Ps 90:11, Ps 119:38, Is 63:17, of me Je 32:40, but subj., thy fear (i.e. thy religion) Job 4:6, Job 22:4.
[[יִרְאַת]] [[יהוֹה]] Ps 19:10 the fear of ´[[י]] = the law as revered.
